body: r_c had always looked up to m_c, and the sight of {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} dead body doesn't feel real. The vigil that night is numb and cold.

m_c was one of those cats who you'd always find right in the thick of things, and it's something r_c greatly admired about {PRONOUN/m_c/object} - {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} drive to help c_n. It's so strange and hard to comprehend, that {PRONOUN/r_c/subject}'ll never see m_c do that again.
As the Clan sits vigil for m_c, swapping stories of {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} life, r_c speaks of what {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} admired about {PRONOUN/m_c/object}, of how m_c inspired {PRONOUN/r_c/object}.
r_c took so much inspiration for how to lead {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} life from m_c's example. Losing m_c has thrust r_c into unknown territory.
m_c was such a shining example of what a Clanmate should be that, without {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} light, r_c feels like {PRONOUN/r_c/subject}{VERB/r_c/'ve/'s} been thrust into darkness.
r_c can hardly believe that the heap of fur in camp is all that's left of m_c - could all {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} qualities that r_c so admired really vanish so easily?
r_c is shaken to realize that the next generation will not have m_c to look up to.
r_c always considered m_c a force for good in c_n. What will their collective future look like without {PRONOUN/m_c/object}?
r_c buries {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} muzzle in m_c's fur, clinging to the memories of all that m_c accomplished to comfort {PRONOUN/r_c/self}.
r_c knows that even now that m_c is dead, {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} legacy will live on in all the admirable deeds {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} did during {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} life. Still, the loss hits r_c hard.
